Header: Re-construction of Churches devastated by terror attacks begins
Content: Reconstruction of St. Sebastian’s Church at Katuwapitiya in Negombo that was devastated due to the terror attacks on Easter Sunday commenced today. It is a joint effort by the Sri Lanka Army and the Sri Lanka Engineering Corporation. Reconstruction work on St. Anthony’s Church in Kochchikade that was damaged in the terrorist attack is already in progress. The main construction is handled by the Sri Lanka Navy with the support of the State Engineering Corporation. In the meantime, the reconstruction work on the Zion Church in Batticaloa is being handled by the Sri Lanka Army and the State Development Corporation. The grants required for this work are supplied by the Ministry of Housing, Construction and Cultural Affairs. The aim is to expeditiously carryout the construction with high standard and better than the Church was there.
